poem:
In the House of Secrets

Red whispers cross oceans,  
a still bridge of cold  
intentions brews beneath  
soft golden arches—  
their hidden truths  
a shadow dance on walls,  
unseen and unspoken.  
The wind carries echoes,  
unraveling webs spun  
in the quiet gloom  
where paper castles fall  
and the dawn's light  
exposes each woven thread.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "TV tonight: inside Donald Trump’s relationship with Vladimir Putin Dispatches: Trump – Moscow’s Man in the White House 9pm, Channel 4This film promises to be an explosive behind-the-scenes investigation into the biggest political story of the decade – and Dispatches always delivers on its word. Former US intelligence officials and White House insiders speak out about Donald Trump’s relationship with Vladimir Putin to help answer the questions: what is really underpinning it? And what will". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
